thread.title: Sting grabs some shut eye by using son as a head rest | Daily Mail Online
thread.title_full: Sting grabs some shut eye by using son as a head rest | Daily Mail Online

author: Sebastian Shakespeare For The Daily Mail
title: Sting grabs some shut eye by using son as a head rest | Daily Mail Online
text: comments Before he took to the stage in California this week, Sting, 65, made use of musician son Joe Sumners' shoulder for a bit of shut-eye When Sting performed in California this week, his set was opened by his musician son Joe Sumner, 40, whose mother was the rock star’s first wife, actress Frances Tomelty. Before he took to the stage, Sting, 65, made use of Joe’s shoulder for a bit of shut-eye. Sumner, who graduated in environmental science from Richmond, the American International University in London, plays in rock band Fiction Plane. Sting has four children by his second wife, Trudie Styler. ‘For me to be on this tour is easy because I have the connections,’ admits Joe. ‘But the emotional work I had to do to get to the place where I was OK with it was not easy.’ It’s a hard life. Downton girls lose all sense of decorum! Whatever would the Dowager Countess of Grantham say? Laura Carmichael and Michelle Dockery couldn’t look more different from their onscreen counterparts in ITV’s costume drama Downton Abbey. The actresses were attending a party in Los Angeles, but they seem to have left their decorum back in Blighty. Laura, 30, who played Lady Edith Crawley, was wearing funky boots and poured champagne into a tumbler — how uncouth. Meanwhile, Dockery, 35, who was cast as her sister Lady Mary, was sporting skin-tight leather trousers and heels. Last month, Lord Fellowes confirmed he has started working on a film based on the TV series. Laura Carmichael and Michelle Dockery couldn’t look more different from their onscreen counterparts in ITV’s costume drama Downton Abbey. The actresses were attending a party in Los Angeles, but they seem to have left their decorum back in Blighty Laura, 30, who played Lady Edith Crawley (left), was wearing funky boots and poured champagne into a tumbler — how uncouth. Meanwhile, Dockery, 35, who was cast as her sister Lady Mary (right), was sporting skin-tight leather trousers and heels. Et tu, Mariella? Broadcaster Mariella Frostrup, 54, has joined the backlash against the much hyped multi-Oscar-nominated musical La La Land, co-starring Ryan Gosling and Emma Stone. ‘This one-tune wonder with a couple of derivative dance numbers set in the world of make-believe they call Hollywood has to be one of the most banal movies of recent decades,’ she says. ‘If this forgettable musical scoops more awards than any other film in history, it will only confirm our desperation to escape the precarious real world. ‘I suspect that if it does triumph on both sides of the Atlantic, we’ll look back and shake our heads in wonder at our own crazy choices.’ RELATED ARTICLES
